# Tireless Pursuit (Spell)
## Overview
[[Transmutation Spells|Transmutation]]

**Level:** [[1st Level Elven Archer Spells|Elven archer 1]], [[1st Level Inquisitor Spells|Inquisitor 1]], [[1st Level Ranger Spells|Ranger 1]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 1st-Level Cleric Spells List|Cleric 1]], [[BoXM 1st-Level Druid Spells List|Druid 1]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S, M (a hard biscuit)

**Range:** Personal

**Target:** You

**Duration:** 1 hour/level (D)

**Saving Throw:** None

**Spell Resistance:** No

**Source:** Advanced Player's Guide, pg. 249

You harden your body against the stresses of long travel. You halve the damage caused by hustling and forced marching (see *Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook* 171). In addition, for the duration of the spell you ignore any fatigue caused by such travel. Once the spell ends, if you still have any nonlethal damage caused by the hustling or forced march, you become [[Fatigued|fatigued]], or [[Exhausted|exhausted]] if already [[Fatigued|fatigued]].

**GM Note**

*House Rule:* Added Elven archer 1 to Level per New Paths Compendium (Kobold Press), pg. 20.
